channel.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
channel.description:
I'm translating some things, and the first step I use is just using Babelfish. I then copy it into Notepad and read it all to check for mistakes. But the text is written in a poem form, like this:
This is the first line, this is the second one, ohnoes a third line, a fourth line here, etc....
But when Babelfish translated the text, the output is something like this: This is the first line, this is the second one, ohnoes a third line, a fourth line here, etc....
I can do it manually, but that will take ages because it's a huge text. I cant use replace all because it doesnt allow a form of 'enter' (or does it?) So my question is, is there a program, or a trick with notepad that allows me to do this?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Thanks .Flair, that was the solution. And bowserjr2, I know it’s best to translate it all by myself. But I do it in two steps, first I translate it with babelfish and then read trough it and correct it. But now I think about it, it’s best to do it all manually because it’s faster.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

I’d recommend using the replace function, but with
instead of enter.

Make it an HTML file and recopy it into NotePad.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Translate all by you self.

Thats is the best.

But what is you translate from and to?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

That wont work because the lines don’t have the same length.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Well, I know something that would help you out a bit I believe. I’m not sure it will totally fix the problem but it should help some. In Notepad, simply go to Format -> Word Wrap. Then, you can change the width of the Notepad window and that should help move the text.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding rows in a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m translating some things, and the first step I use is just using Babelfish. I then copy it into Notepad and read it all to check for mistakes. But the text is written in a poem form, like this:

This is the first line,
this is the second one,
ohnoes a third line,
a fourth line here,
etc…

But when Babelfish translated the text, the output is something like this:
This is the first line, this is the second one, ohnoes a third line, a fourth line here, etc…

I can do it manually, but that will take ages because it’s a huge text. I cant use replace all because it doesnt allow a form of ‘enter’ (or does it?) So my question is, is there a program, or a trick with notepad that allows me to do this?

Thanks in advance.
